title: Mexico's President Wants More BTS Concerts for Fans
summary: Mexico's president, Claudia Sheinbaum, asked South Korea's president for more BTS concerts in Mexico. BTS is a popular K-pop band that is going on a big world tour after four years. They will have three shows in Mexico City in May, but tickets sold out very fast in less than 40 minutes. Many young people wanted tickets, but there were not enough for everyone. Some people are selling tickets for much higher prices, which is not fair. The president hopes South Korea will say yes to more shows so more fans can see BTS. BTS is very loved in Mexico, and listening to K-pop has grown a lot there.

background_read: BTS is a very popular music group from South Korea that sings K-pop songs. They have many fans all over the world, including in Mexico. After not performing together for four years, they are going on a big tour to many countries. Concerts are fun events where people can see their favorite bands live, but sometimes tickets are hard to get because so many people want them. Presidents are important leaders who can help make things happen, like asking for more shows to make fans happy.
Article_Structure: WHO: Mexico's president Claudia Sheinbaum and BTS fans
WHAT: The president asked South Korea for more BTS concerts because tickets sold out fast
WHERE: Mexico City in Mexico and South Korea
WHY: To help more young fans see BTS, as the band is very popular and tickets are scarce
